body_html:
@LionSR, if your matrix is Hermitian or symmetric, you could create your own op with self_adjoint_eig, elementwise exponentiation, and matrix multiplication which would be differentiable.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matrix_exponential#Diagonalizable_case

@LionSR, if your matrix is Hermitian or symmetric, you could create your own op with self_adjoint_eig, elementwise exponentiation, and matrix multiplication which would be differentiable.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matrix_exponential#Diagonalizable_case
body:
@LionSR, if your matrix is Hermitian or symmetric, you could create your own op with self_adjoint_eig, elementwise exponentiation, and matrix multiplication which would be differentiable.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matrix_exponential#Diagonalizable_case
